noun.description: A member of the indigenous people dominant in Mexico before the Spanish conquest of the 16th century.
The extinct language of the Aztecs, a Uto-Aztecan language from which modern Nahuatl is descended.

adjective.description: Relating to the Aztecs or their language.

origin: From French Aztèque or Spanish Azteca, from Nahuatl aztecatl person of Aztlan, their legendary place of origin.
